definition: a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The US still consumes more than it produces, running a chronic trade deficit.
sentences.chinese: 美国仍然是消费多于生产，留下了长期性的贸易逆差。

sentences.english: Residual effects from these conditions can cause long-term scarring and pock marks.
sentences.chinese: 这些情况的残余后果就是，皮肤长期性的疤痕和痘印。

sentences.english: At the same time, we should also be soberly aware that East Asia cooperation is a long-haul journey.
sentences.chinese: 同时，我们也要对东亚合作的长期性有清醒的认识。

sentences.english: Nursing management needs to focus on the chronicity of the disease and preventing visual impairment.
sentences.chinese: 护理重点是疾病的长期性和防止视力受损。

sentences.english: An important aspect of business processes is their longevity and interaction with people.
sentences.chinese: 业务流程的一个重要特点是其长期性和与人的交互性。

sentences.english: These are decisions for the long term that a caretaker government simply cannot take.
sentences.chinese: 但这些长期性的决策并非是看守政府能处理的。

sentences.english: Cancer is the biggest long-term risk.
sentences.chinese: 癌症现在是人类史上最大的长期性的隐患。

sentences.english: The system is therefore an issue fundamental, overall, stable, and long-term in nature.
sentences.chinese: 制度问题更带有根本性，全局性，稳定性和长期性。

sentences.english: Then, as he does now, Krugman ignored the adverse long-term consequences of the policies he advocated.
sentences.chinese: 克鲁格曼忽视了相反的他倡导的政策的长期性后果。

sentences.english: And some advocacy groups question the long-term safety of irradiation.
sentences.chinese: 另外一些支持团体对辐照的长期性安全感到怀疑。

sentences.english: Europe is making a big mistake in the longrun.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲正在犯下一个长期性的大错误。

sentences.english: A long, hard battle now looms in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 一个艰难的长期性斗争已在参议院初露端倪。

sentences.english: It is necessary to have a profound understanding of the long-term, tough and complex nature of the work against corruption.
sentences.chinese: 要深刻认识反腐工作白勺长期性，艰巨性和复杂性。

sentences.english: The anti-poverty is a long-term and arduous struggle that demands the introduction of legal mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 反贫困斗争的长期性和艰巨性要求法律机制的介入。

definition: long term/long time/long range (of a forecast)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
